title: Monthly Treeverse Update #34
content:
An update on Treeverse. A look at our development and art team progress. We will be posting monthly for you to follow along the development of Treeverse, so make sure you subscribe!

We’ve finally started rolling out hundreds of playable builds to players this month. Over the last few years we have realized that talking about deadlines early never works out well even if we are eager to share things with our community. From now on we will give plenty of room and only announce a deadline once we are certain on launch.

The good thing is we will be sending out many more builds to users every few days!

For more details on how we are approaching this upcoming alpha launch, read the Going Forward section below.

Check our account for many gameplay videos, here are a few below:

Art Update

Engineering And Design

We started doing external testing and fixed a bunch of things as we continue working towards alpha release. We were able to provide testing opportunities to a small group of community members and holders on IOS, Windows, Mac and on Android. We worked on fixing major critical issues and also ran a small scale stress test with 1000 bots without significant issues. We plan to slowly increase this to 10,000 and then eventually 100,000 after resolving some database related issues.

We got multiple builds out within the span of this month, with patch notes to show what we fixed / have been working on. We’re also working on finalising the launcher on desktop, to make it easier for people to test the latest versions as we provide builds for those.

We also got the pre-requisites for being on the android developer program, so can start pushing android versions like we do for IOS versions which should be quite a bit easier that it currently is at the moment.

New Features / Added

  • Progression Tree feature allowing you to view information about the game and what you have access to / can unlock.

  • Anti-aliasing quality control options

  • Dots debugging for tracking potential bugs / issues

  • Progressive loading of many UIs on client

  • Level locks to dungeons & teleporters.

  • Diagnostic logs to help find potential cause of crash.

  • Free camera. Can zoom in/out and rotate up and down.

  • Confirmation screen when exiting a dungeon.

  • Endless Clouds launcher is functional, but still needs a bit of work for handling edge cases.

  • Graphical options

  • Daily experience reward feature & streak

  • Basic profanity check for names

  • Saving of player analytics data such as monsters killed, items crafted, gathered, damage taken etc.

  • Versioning between client and server

  • Developer only build option to speed up how long it takes to build the game for testing purposes

Fixed

  • Stop colliding with dead bodies

  • Prevent double counting of logged in players

  • Destructibles are working now

  • Error spam due to VFX

  • Green/blue eyes

  • Map input block to stop players accidentally exiting dungeon

  • Fix disconnection issue when trying to connect to server sometimes

  • Fixed distance/range of some projectile abilities

  • Crafting / Transaction system fixes that were causing crashes on game server

  • Major networking bug that was causing application to crash

  • UI issue on android where button clicks where not getting registered should now be fixed. Requires further testing on a wide range of devices

  • Major android shader issues resolved

  • Dodge abilities normalised, but the range is too long, so that’s been fixed

  • Minimap rotation fixed

  • Fixed various collider issues around the world and in the swamp especially

  • Fixed engraving issue causing clients to crash

  • Fixed abnormal prices of some items

  • Various tags added to items

  • Backtrace performance issues fixed when multiple players in the same area

Going Forward

We are pushing back our alpha release date. We don’t have an exact date for you. We will release it once we have all the things we want it and its tested properly.

With the reward campaign meant to take place at Alpha launch and the first big open launch ever, we want to take a bit more time to polish the build. This is to ensure we make the most out of this launch.

Going forward, we will no longer provide any estimates or deadlines publicly. We’re adopting a policy of “ When Its Ready”. Things will be released when they’re ready. We’ve made this mistake of announcing/hinting towards estimated dates in the past (hence the 1-2 weeks) meme, and unfortunately got caught up in it again. This won’t happen again. We will continue providing updates on our progress via these monthly reports, where we are headed, the issues we face and also provide testing opportunities for select community members.

But we know so many of you are eager to play so before the official alpha we will slowly roll it out to more people prioritizing holders until all holders have access even before the official launch.

We’re going to keep pushing regular updates to the testing versions based on feedback and bug reports, and adding new things incrementally, community members can take a look for themselves.

Disclaimer: Please note that anything written in this document should not be taken as financial advice. Endless Clouds is dedicated to producing a fun, enjoyable game that integrates NFTs. NFTs are a new and highly experimental technology and should not be bought for investment purposes.
